unnormalised: **Gas Cylinder Prices Give Diwali Budget a Shocker!**
normalised: **Gas Cylinder Prices Give Diwali Budget a Shocker!**

unnormalised: Hey folks, looks like your Diwali deep cleaning isn't the only thing giving you a sweat. Gas cylinder prices just got a bump-up, again! Sources say, Bharat Petroleum and Indane are raising prices by Rs. 50 per cylinder effective immediately.
normalised: Hey folks, looks like your Diwali deep cleaning isn't the only thing giving you a sweat. Gas cylinder prices just got a bump-up, again! Sources say, Bharat Petroleum and Indane are raising prices by rupee fifty per cylinder effective immediately.

unnormalised: That delicious Diwali biryani you were planning? Might need a little cost reassessment, amma!
normalised: That delicious Diwali biryani you were planning? Might need a little cost reassessment, amma!

unnormalised: This latest hike comes just weeks before the festival of lights, putting a strain on household budgets, especially for those celebrating in cities like Chennai and Delhi. Industry experts at IIM Ahmedabad are scratching their heads, saying global crude oil prices are only part of the story. Apparently, distribution costs across long distances, like shipping cylinders to remote villages in Rajasthan, add to the final price.
normalised: This latest hike comes just weeks before the festival of lights, putting a strain on household budgets, especially for those celebrating in cities like Chennai and Delhi. Industry experts at I I M Ahmedabad are scratching their heads, saying global crude oil prices are only part of the story. Apparently, distribution costs across long distances, like shipping cylinders to remote villages in Rajasthan, add to the final price.

unnormalised: Consumers are already feeling the pinch. "Rs. 50 is a lot! That's almost enough for a kilo of sweets," complained Lakshmi from Mumbai. This marks the third hike in as many months, adding up to nearly Rs. 150 extra per cylinder. Let's hope things cool down before the festival frenzy really kicks in!
normalised: Consumers are already feeling the pinch. "Rupee fifty is a lot! That's almost enough for a kilogram of sweets," complained Lakshmi from Mumbai. This marks the third hike in as many months, adding up to nearly rupee one hundred and fifty extra per cylinder. Let's hope things cool down before the festival frenzy really kicks in!
